description: Loans can be a useful financial tool for large purchases like a home or education, but they must be managed responsibly to avoid debt traps.
sentences: A good credit score is crucial for getting loans at favorable interest rates.
Differentiate between 'good loans' (e.g., home, education) and 'bad loans' (e.g., high-interest personal loans for lifestyle spends).
Your total EMIs should ideally not exceed 40-50% of your take-home salary.
Always read the loan agreement carefully before signing.
Making extra payments towards the principal can significantly reduce the loan tenure and interest paid.
dos: Compare interest rates and fees from multiple lenders.
Pay your EMIs on time, every time.
Try to prepay your loan whenever you have surplus funds.
Keep your credit score high by maintaining good credit habits.
donts: Don't borrow more than you can comfortably repay.
Don't take a loan for speculative investments.
Avoid taking on multiple high-interest loans simultaneously.
Don't co-sign a loan for someone unless you are prepared to repay it yourself.
